pros: It has been a positive environment.
cons: It's long commute for me.

review_title: Great for Experience, Horrible for Overall Satisfaction
pros: AMAZING people. I loved the healthcare team I worked with. All the nurses and doctors were really caring and approachable, we made a lot of great memories together. You also get to see and do a lot in this role, they give you quite a bit of autonomy which is great for experience. You'll feel prepared for other jobs in the medical field.
cons: Atrocious pay. Turnover rate is high because other hospitals pay so much better for often times less work. They really expect a lot out of you for a dollar above minimum wage. HR is completely unwilling to listen to your grievances.

pros: I love the people I work with and it’a great place for a new grad.
cons: The pay is very low.

pros: variety of surgeries most co workers were very friendly and willing to teach
cons: none good place to start

job_title: PSA/Patient Safety Assistant in Arcadia, CA
pros: A learning environment for medically interested. Various departments and client types. A great deal of mental health experience gained.
cons: Quite a bit of down time sometimes. Can drive people crazy. Don’t get lost in your daydreams either, you need to pay attention to every patient, even while they’re sleeping!

pros: friendly, supportive work culture in 5N nights; opportunities to learn and grow

pros: Teams are great to work with.

review_title: Since new management team came in almost one year ago, staff loyalty and morale have steadily declined.
pros: In general, the staff is friendly and helpful. It is a nice family atmosphere. The longer one is here, the more comfortable it feels.
cons: The current environment is not supportive of the staff in general. Some of the new management team appear to spend money freely on lunches, dinners, gifts, office renovations while reducing and eliminating benefits for the "rank and file." It is not a morale booster. People have been hired as well-paid directors while others have been loyally pulling their weight and more trying to fill in gaps, yet with seemingly no recognition or financial remuneration.

review_title: Amazing community, good benefits, underpaid, under promoted, unappreciated, enjoyable work.
pros:
- Great people to work with for the most part
- The community of the employees has a real desire to be like a family even though Administration no longer fosters a family atmosphere
- The work is enjoyable
cons:
- Employees have not been given a real raise in over 5 years. 
-Promises made to promote were delayed and rejected due to politics and personal vendettas to keep costs low and keep their own job looking good to Administration for more than a year before I quit

pros: I can't really think of any pros at the moment.
cons: RN's can get abusive to CNA's in front of patients. Treated as if mentally retarded by doctors. No respect in this building for "lower" staff. Terrible management.

pros:
Job Flexibility 
In house health care for employees, cost effective for employees', and efficient
cons:
Career growth 
Lack of upper management motivation
HR department 
Lack of employee engagement

pros: great people to work with
cons: Can't say all dept but in my and in others that I have dealt with have bad department Directors and some Supervisors are really bad. Some have been there for over 15 years and still don't know names of their employees and also, both just sit in the office all day and only come out to see what people are up to.

review_title: Everyone was friendly however management/ CEO etc could be better.
pros: I really liked the people here everyone was helpful, and the environment feels like everyone was a giant family.
cons: I hated being flexed and cancelled. Basically cancelled in the morning then called to come back in just to flex. I hated how they tried to cut pennies and dimes in every corner. Underpaid than surrounding hospitals and definitely under appreciated. Several co-workers left due to the fact that we never got full-time hours and were required to use personal vacation/sick time to cover those hours due to the fact that we were constantly being sent home.

review_title: New Management provides little comfort to the new direction of the hospital
pros: Most of your peers are good people to be around.
cons: Top management fails to share important information with staff.  Information that is shared has been watered down and sanitized compared to the actual truth.

pros: good benefits, insurance, good coworkers to be around, close knit family
cons: bad ratio, sometimes forced to take on too many patients

pros: Very busy, face paced environment. Always something that needs to be addressed or worked on.
cons: Lack of work/life balance. Unmanageable workloads. PTO accrual where Sick and Vacation hours are in the same bank (You only accrue 2 weeks max). High turnover rates, especially in the IT department. Too many employees go on Leave possibly due to the high stress levels.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Arcadia, CA
pros:
Beautiful facility
Cafeteria food is delicious and always fresh.
Facility is always clean and kept up.
Some friendly employees
cons:
High employee turn over rate 
Over worked and under paid. 
Staff doesn't seem to care much about patients and their concerns. 
Favoritism towards the non hardworking while the hard workers get over looked. 
Management is cold hearted and not understanding.
Pay rate is low.
Would cut shifts with out notifying employee.
Management is terrible at being a good example to employees

pros: A good work environment, friendly people for the most part. Clean hospital. The parking is very easy here. State of the art equipment.
cons: Compensation and benefits are not good compared to other hospitals. They expect so much out there employees but do not recognize hard work, if you are lazy you get away very easily.

pros: Excellent patient care,  Patients come here for specialty care and great outcomes, Day care on site for employees
cons: Point system, understaffed, tired staff who are trying their best, poor benefits, nursing pay is lower than other hospitals.

pros: Great working environment.  People are friendly.  Cafeteria good is yummy.  Great benefits.
cons: Healthcare field can be hard to financially grow.  Promotions can be difficult but not impossible.

pros: Nice staff. Flexible schedule. Benefits offered are good. Nice atmosphere.
cons: Sometimes short on staff, extra work load, no additional help sent to help you. Nursing Admin will not send some one to help you if short an Assistant.

pros: Easy parking, nice clean facility, beautiful neighborhood location
cons: Repressive administration, low wages, high employee turnover due to poor benefits. No separate sick day PTO.  Few opportunities to grow.

pros: Excellent community hospital offering all medical services.

review_title: Terrible management, pay, benefits. Awesome staff.
pros: Nurses and techs are amazing to work with. Small hospital that feels like family. Next to the mall and race track.
cons: Terrible health insurance, especially for children. The pay is very low with no specialty pay. Paid time off accumulation is almost non-existent.
